metadata.title: CVE-2018-17281 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: There is a stack consumption vulnerability in the res_http_websocket.so module of Asterisk through 13.23.0, 14.7.x through 14.7.7, and 15.x through 15.6.0 and Certified Asterisk through 13.21-cert2. It allows an attacker to crash Asterisk via a specially crafted HTTP request to upgrade the connection to a websocket.

criterions.comment: asterisk package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.2.1~dfsg-1').
